Baca Pleidoi Kasus e-KTP, Markus Nangis Cerita Tak Terima Gaji-Anak Dibully
04 Nov 2019, 16:02 by Zunita Putri
Jakarta - Mantan Anggota DPR Markus Nari menangis saat membacakan pleidoi (nota pembelaan). Markus mengaku tertekan karena tersandung kasus dugaan korupsi e-KTP.
"Selama dua tahun lebih saya merasakan penderitaan, tertekan, terhina dan terisolasi dari sahabat, kerabat baik secara nasional maupun konstituen di daerah pemilihan saya. Semua rekening bank saya diblokir oleh KPK sehingga gaji yang masuk ke rekening tersebut tidak dapat saya terima. Hal itu bukan hanya dirasakan oleh saya namun Istri, anak-anak saya dan keluarga besar ikut terkena dampak," kata Markus saat membacakan pleidoi di PN Jakarta Pusat, Jalan Bungur Besar Raya, Jakarta Pusat, Senin (4/11/2019).
Sambil menangis, Markus juga bercerita keluarganya kerap mendapatkan bully di lingkungan sosialnya. Dia mengaku anaknya saat ini tidak melanjutkan pendidikan karena takut diejek oleh temannya.
"Yang jadi pikiran terberat saya adalah anak saya yang baru saja menyelesaikan pendidikan SMU sampai dengan sekarang tidak melanjutkan pendidikan di perguruan tinggi karena takut di-bully, dijauhi, diejek," kata Markus sambil menangis.
"Seharusnya anak saya tidak perlu merasakan dampak dari masalah ini, mengingat dia masih muda dan mempunyai hak untuk menempuh dunia pendidikan," imbuhnya.
Markus mengaku sedih dengan tuntutan jaksa KPK selama 9 tahun penjara. Dia meminta hakim mempertimbangkan pleidoinya.
Markus membantah menerima sejumlah uang terkait proyek e-KTP. Markus mengaku belum melihat wujud uang sepeti didakwakan jaksa KPK.
"Saya tidak pernah menerima dan atau diberikan uang oleh saksi Sugiharto, saya tidak pernah melihat uang dalam bentuk apapun dan saya tidak pernah meminta dari saksi Irman. Saya juga tidak pernah menerima dan melihat uang dari saksi Irvanto dalam bentuk apapun," katanya.

Read Pleidoi Case for e-KTP, Markus Nangis, Story of Not Accepting Salary-Children Being bullied
Nov 04 2019, 16:02 by Zunita Putri
Jakarta - Former DPR member Markus Nari cried while reading pleidoi (defense memorandum). Markus admitted that he was depressed because he stumbled over a case of alleged e-KTP corruption.
"For more than two years I have felt suffering, depressed, insulted and isolated from friends, relatives both nationally and constituents in my constituency. All of my bank accounts were blocked by the KPK so that the salary entered into the account was not acceptable to me. It was not it was only felt by me but my wife, children and extended family were affected, "Markus said as he read pleading at the Central Jakarta District Court, Jalan Bungur Besar Raya, Central Jakarta, Monday (11/04/2019).
While crying, Markus also told his family often get bullies in his social environment. He claimed his son did not currently continue his education for fear of being ridiculed by his friend.
"What became my biggest thought was that my son, who had just finished high school up to now, had not continued his education in college for fear of being bullied, shunned, ridiculed," Markus said, crying.
"My child should not need to feel the effects of this problem, bearing in mind that he is young and has the right to take up education," he added.
Markus said he was saddened by the demands of the KPK prosecutor for 9 years in prison. He asked the judge to consider his plea.
Markus denied receiving some money related to the e-KTP project. Markus claimed not to have seen the form of money as the KPK prosecutor had charged.
"I have never received and or given money by witness Sugiharto, I have never seen money in any form and I have never asked from witness Irman. I have also never received and seen money from witness Irvanto in any form," he said.
